title: first impressions // k. bakugou
body:
so, my first ever boku no hero academia imagine. wish me luck!!

  gender in this imagine will be female, if you wish for me to create this with male or genderneutral pronouns please feel free to send a message my way! i would be happy to help!

warnings: none? maybe language bc baku tho

word count: 2.3k

summary: it was a night to be remembered. pro-heroes from every agency across the country had arranged a special event for their sidekicks and employees to attend; a grand, masquerade ball, if you will. it’s there that you meet an angry blond, one whose eyes hardly leave you.


  the pro-hero’s ball was an event you’d been looking forward to for months, already having a dress and matching shoes since it had been announced in november. it was the night of, your hair styled perfectly, makeup done by one of the professional makeup artists in your agency, your black hero mask being the only thing you had decided to wear from your hero costume, and you were scheduled to be picked up within the hour, escorted by one of the highest ranking sidekicks of your agency.

  a tight-fitting, black gown hugged your figure, the deep neckline accentuating your chest as your collarbones shimmered with the highlight your makeup artist had applied. black stilettos gave you an extra five-inch height boost, your legs showing off nicely from the slit up your right leg. your hair hung in loose ringlets, shaping your face and giving you an air of elegance, though most times you felt far from such. you were definitely more of the nitty-gritty, fight-villains-all-day kind of girl, but this was a nice change. tonight, you didn’t have to worry about that. tonight was a night to relax.

  you had clambered into a large suv, red riot’s arm slung around your shoulders as he talked animatedly about seeing his old classmates from yuuei. he had recently transferred to your agency a few months ago due to a rise in crime in your district, and you’d grown to love the enthusiastic redhead.

  “i can’t wait to see bakugou again,” he grinned, “i haven’t seen him since my transfer!”

  “i’m sure he’ll be glad to see you as well, kiri-kun,” you smiled.

  he scratched the back of his neck with his hand, “yeah, well, maybe. he’s a bit of a stick in the mud, though. might be too pissed off he was forced to come.”

  “oh?” you mused, “that’s too bad.”

  kirishima shrugged, “who knows though, maybe he changed a bit in my absence. doubtful, though. but! i’m excited to see my other old classmates, too! i hope i get to see ashido and kaminari.”

  “that’s the alien girl and electricity guy, right? and bakugou’s the… he’s the explosion guy? the one from the sports festival six years ago?”

  “yep!”

  the ride to the ball had continued with small talk and curious guesses as to what the night would include, but neither of you could have imagined the vast group of paparazzi standing outside with flashing cameras, or numerous fans awaiting the arrival of their favorite sidekicks and pro-heroes.

  you gulped, heart racing in your chest.

  yes, you were definitely considered one of the most fearless sidekicks in your agency, and you fought with the utmost confidence in your quirk and actions. but, crowds and paparazzi were definitely not your favorite. you hated being in the spotlight, and that fact certainly wasn’t going to change tonight.

  kirishima, being the observant man he was, noticed your sudden anxiety and placed a warm hand on the small of your back. you jumped and looked over at him, a calm and reassuring smile on his face.

  “you can do this, (name), i believe in you,” he murmured.

  you gave him a tight-lipped smile, “thanks, kiri-kun.”

  “ready?”

  “as i’ll ever be.”

  he slipped around you, and the passenger door opened, the once-muted cries of reporters now amplified and sending a new wave of anxiety crashing over you. he slid out of the car, offering you a hand and pulling you out after him.

  “(hero name)! (hero name)! over here!”

  “look this way, (hero name)!”

  “(hero name), do you have time for some questions?”

  you plastered on a smile, forced and looking uncomfortable as you apologized and stuck as close to kirishima as you could without leading the reporters to believe something was going on between the two of you; that was the last thing you needed, some false rumor that you and red riot were an item.

  security had seen the two of you approach, opening the doors for you and wishing you to have a good evening. you wished them the same before your eyes fell on the beautifully-decorated and overly-crowded ballroom.

  there was an open bar in the middle of the room, a dance floor located in the far left corner, tables placed throughout while groups of heroes and sidekicks talked animatedly among each other. everyone was dressed to impress with at least one piece of their costume to complete their outfit, most wearing their masks like you had done. there were a few faces you remembered seeing from various battles or on television, but you had no idea where you had wanted to go first.

  kirishima, always one step ahead of you, placed his hand on your back again, “come on, i see some friends i want to introduce you to!”

  you nodded, “okay!”

  he led you down the stairs and towards one of the tables located near the bar. you were stopped a few times by people saying hello to either of you two before kirishima’s hand left your back and he walked ahead of you to the table.

  “eiji-kun!” a girl with pink hair and pink skin called out excitedly.

  the rest of the group turned to see the redhead with wide smiles, welcoming him with a hug and multiple questions of “how are you? how have you been?!”

  you stood awkwardly to the side until the pink-haired girl noticed you with wide, black and gold eyes. “eiji-kun, is this your girlfriend?!”

  your eyes widened, “huh?! n-no! we’re not—”

  “sorry, guys, i’m still single as ever! this is my partner at the agency i was transferred to, (name), also known as—”

  “(hero name),” the black-haired boy muttered in awe. “i’ve seen your work! it’s so nice to meet you! this is like, a dream come true!”

  a blush blossomed across your cheeks, “o-oh, thank you!”

  “i’m ashido!” the pink-haired girl grinned, “this is sero,” she motioned to the black-haired one, “and kaminari!” the boy with the lightning bolt stripe in his bangs smirked.

  “have you seen bakugou yet? i want to introduce him to (name),” kirishima asked.

  “bakugou’s coming?!” kaminari asked incredulously.

  “that’s what he told me,” the redhead replied with a shrug. “though, he probably found a way to get out of it.” his lips pulled into a frown, “damn, i was really looking forward to seeing him again.”

  ashido gave kirishima a small smile, “he might turn up sooner or later! but, now that you’re here, we should all go dancing!”

  kaminari’s eyes lit up, “that sounds like a great idea, you coming, (hero name)?”

  “me? oh, uh, i don’t know—“

  “come on, it’ll be fun, i promise!” kirishima pulled you with him to the dance floor, the rest of the bakusquad following suit. there was some shitty, bass-heavy club music booming from the speakers, and you could barely hear yourself think as kirishima took your hands and started to dance with you.

  your cheeks blossomed with a bright red, and you hesitantly started to dance with him, trying to find an equal rhythm with your partner. 

  it wasn’t long until you found a groove, and you started swinging your hips to the beat, the dress allowing for a little more movement than you would have expected from the tightly-fitting attire. ashido started to grind on you, and you gasped, not expecting that from the practical-stranger who you’d met not even five minutes ago, but you went along with it.

  you let your eyes wander off the dance floor as you looked around, and you notice a pair of crimson eyes trained on you from the upstairs balcony of tables, his arms resting on the rail as he was slouched over the edge. you quickly looked away, refusing to believe that the blond had been staring at you.

  a few songs later, you lot had decided to walk back to the table, sweaty and slightly out of breath. 

  “so, kirishima, what’s (name) like? big change from bakugou?” sero asked, taking a swig of whiskey from his glass. you were off getting a round of waters for the table at the bar, not a big fan of drinking yourself.

  the redhead shrugged, “somewhat. they’re both pretty wild on the battlefield, but she’s definitely nicer and a lot more levelheaded. just as observant, too, nothing gets passed her. though, she doesn’t call me shitty hair all the time.”

  “and here i thought you liked the nickname,” a voice grumbled from behind him.

  the group whipped their heads around to see bakugou dressed in a nice suit with his hero mask, mouths gaping in surprise with their eyes wide.

  “bakugou!” ashido exclaimed, giving the irritated blond a hug.

  “you actually came!” kirishima was more excited than a puppy going for a walk, wide grin plastered across his face.

  tch. “i’ve been here for a while, saw you guys looking like idiots out there,” he replied. “oi, pinky, let go of me already.”

  ashido let go of him with a sheepish blush, “sorry, it’s been so long, baku-kun! we all missed you so much!”

  “yeah, yeah,” he grumbled. “so, where’s that girl you were dancing with? she my replacement?”

  speak of the devil; you waltzed over to the table with cups stacked on top of each other in one hand, a pitcher of ice cold water in the other. “hey! sorry it took so long, this one guy would not stop talking to me,” you complained as you set the stuff down on the table, failing to notice the blond gaping at you.

  kirishima dismissed the apology with a wave of his hand, “it’s fine!”

  “yeah, you did look pretty hot out there!” kaminari wiggled his eyebrows suggestively.

  you blushed, “k-kaminari–”

  “where the fuck are your manners, pikachu?” bakugou glared.

  you jumped, finally noticing the blond who was staring at you earlier, “o-oh! you scared me.”

  he clicked his tongue, not responding to you. however, his eyes still lingered for a moment before he turned back to kirishima. “you gonna stand there, or you gonna introduce us, shitty hair?”

  the redhead blushed, “oh, bakugou, this is (name), aka (hero name), (name), this is bakugou.”

  your eyes widened, “this is bakugou?!”

  the blond glared, “what?! somethin’ wrong with me?”

  “n-no!” you stammered, holding your hands up in surrender. “i-i’ve just heard so much about you! it’s nice to finally meet you.”

  he rolled his eyes, but he didn’t say anything.

  you huffed at his behavior and turned to kirishima and his conversation with kaminari, sero, and ashido, pitching in here and there.

  when you all had quenched your thirst and sero and ashido finally reached their desired level of drunken-ness, kirishima had suggested you all head back to the dance floor, bakugou immediately declining. the other four had accepted his answer, but you hung back, not used to bakugou and knowing to leave his first answer as his final answer.

  you looked over at him, “can’t dance?”

  he scowled, “i can dance, i just don’t want to.”

  “oh, well, do you want company?” you asked.

  “just go with shitty hair, i’ll be fine by myself,” he replied.

  “are you sure?”

  “if i fucking dance with you guys, will you leave me alone?” he snapped.

  your eyes widened, “i-i–”

  he grabbed your hand, the heat of his palm surprising you, and pulled you along through the throng of people. you two couldn’t exactly get to where kirishima, kaminari, ashido, and sero were, so you stuck to some random place in the crowd.

  you hesitated, not sure exactly what to do, but you gasped as he grabbed your arms to toss around his neck, and he slipped his hands around your waist.

  “this alright with you?” he asked in your ear, you barely able to hear him over the loud music.

  you nodded and slowly started to dance with the boy, still keeping a little bit of distance. after all, you two had just met.

  “come on, i know you can dance better than that,” he smirked.

  a blush rose to your cheeks, “i, uh–”

  he pulled you tighter, your body flush against him as he started to move your bodies to the beat of the song, the smirk never leaving his cocky face. “let me know if you get uncomfortable,” he said.

  you nodded, and your body started to warm up to his, hips moving a bit more freely as you started to feel more secure with your movements, getting back into the groove you had earlier. you were completely enveloped in his scent, smelling of burnt sugar with a slight hint of campfire smoke. to others, it may have smelled strange, but it smelled heavenly to you.

  “so,” you started, gaining a bit of confidence with the hotheaded stranger, “were my eyes playing tricks, or were you staring at me earlier?” a blush still played on your cheeks as you asked him, but you daringly looked the blond in the eyes, crimson and (eye color) meeting. you looked down from his intense stare, a bit embarrassed.

  “caught that, huh?” he flashed his pearly whites. “shitty hair was right, nothing gets passed you.”

  your brows furrowed in confusion, “huh?” you looked up, realizing how close the two of you really were when your noses bumped together.

  “so, tell me, if you’re as observant as shitty hair says you are, can you tell what i want to do right now?” he whispered into your ear, lips pulled upward in a cocky grin. he pulled back to see your flustered face.

  “i, uh, i’m not sure–”

  “then stop me if it gets too far.”

  without another word, his lips met yours, crashing hard with lust and his hands gripped tightly into your waist. you let out a slight moan at the contact, fingers reaching up and pulling at his hair.

  however, just before the kiss became too heated, you heard a couple of wolfwhistles. you pulled away from bakugou quickly, cheeks a bright red as you noticed kirishima, kaminari, ashido, and sero cheering the two of you on.

  bakugou scowled at them, separating from you. he looked back to you. “to be continued, perhaps? friday night at seven?”

  your eyes widened, “y-yeah, sounds good.”


it’s a bit lengthy, but first ever imagine! wooooo

trail.content_raw:
so, my first ever boku no hero academia imagine. wish me luck!!

  gender in this imagine will be female, if you wish for me to create this with male or genderneutral pronouns please feel free to send a message my way! i would be happy to help!

warnings: none? maybe language bc baku tho

word count: 2.3k

summary: it was a night to be remembered. pro-heroes from every agency across the country had arranged a special event for their sidekicks and employees to attend; a grand, masquerade ball, if you will. it’s there that you meet an angry blond, one whose eyes hardly leave you.


  the pro-hero’s ball was an event you’d been looking forward to for months, already having a dress and matching shoes since it had been announced in november. it was the night of, your hair styled perfectly, makeup done by one of the professional makeup artists in your agency, your black hero mask being the only thing you had decided to wear from your hero costume, and you were scheduled to be picked up within the hour, escorted by one of the highest ranking sidekicks of your agency.

  a tight-fitting, black gown hugged your figure, the deep neckline accentuating your chest as your collarbones shimmered with the highlight your makeup artist had applied. black stilettos gave you an extra five-inch height boost, your legs showing off nicely from the slit up your right leg. your hair hung in loose ringlets, shaping your face and giving you an air of elegance, though most times you felt far from such. you were definitely more of the nitty-gritty, fight-villains-all-day kind of girl, but this was a nice change. tonight, you didn’t have to worry about that. tonight was a night to relax.

  you had clambered into a large suv, red riot’s arm slung around your shoulders as he talked animatedly about seeing his old classmates from yuuei. he had recently transferred to your agency a few months ago due to a rise in crime in your district, and you’d grown to love the enthusiastic redhead.

  “i can’t wait to see bakugou again,” he grinned, “i haven’t seen him since my transfer!”

  “i’m sure he’ll be glad to see you as well, kiri-kun,” you smiled.

  he scratched the back of his neck with his hand, “yeah, well, maybe. he’s a bit of a stick in the mud, though. might be too pissed off he was forced to come.”

  “oh?” you mused, “that’s too bad.”

  kirishima shrugged, “who knows though, maybe he changed a bit in my absence. doubtful, though. but! i’m excited to see my other old classmates, too! i hope i get to see ashido and kaminari.”

  “that’s the alien girl and electricity guy, right? and bakugou’s the… he’s the explosion guy? the one from the sports festival six years ago?”

  “yep!”

  the ride to the ball had continued with small talk and curious guesses as to what the night would include, but neither of you could have imagined the vast group of paparazzi standing outside with flashing cameras, or numerous fans awaiting the arrival of their favorite sidekicks and pro-heroes.

  you gulped, heart racing in your chest.

  yes, you were definitely considered one of the most fearless sidekicks in your agency, and you fought with the utmost confidence in your quirk and actions. but, crowds and paparazzi were definitely not your favorite. you hated being in the spotlight, and that fact certainly wasn’t going to change tonight.

  kirishima, being the observant man he was, noticed your sudden anxiety and placed a warm hand on the small of your back. you jumped and looked over at him, a calm and reassuring smile on his face.

  “you can do this, (name), i believe in you,” he murmured.

  you gave him a tight-lipped smile, “thanks, kiri-kun.”

  “ready?”

  “as i’ll ever be.”

  he slipped around you, and the passenger door opened, the once-muted cries of reporters now amplified and sending a new wave of anxiety crashing over you. he slid out of the car, offering you a hand and pulling you out after him.

  “(hero name)! (hero name)! over here!”

  “look this way, (hero name)!”

  “(hero name), do you have time for some questions?”

  you plastered on a smile, forced and looking uncomfortable as you apologized and stuck as close to kirishima as you could without leading the reporters to believe something was going on between the two of you; that was the last thing you needed, some false rumor that you and red riot were an item.

  security had seen the two of you approach, opening the doors for you and wishing you to have a good evening. you wished them the same before your eyes fell on the beautifully-decorated and overly-crowded ballroom.

  there was an open bar in the middle of the room, a dance floor located in the far left corner, tables placed throughout while groups of heroes and sidekicks talked animatedly among each other. everyone was dressed to impress with at least one piece of their costume to complete their outfit, most wearing their masks like you had done. there were a few faces you remembered seeing from various battles or on television, but you had no idea where you had wanted to go first.

  kirishima, always one step ahead of you, placed his hand on your back again, “come on, i see some friends i want to introduce you to!”

  you nodded, “okay!”

  he led you down the stairs and towards one of the tables located near the bar. you were stopped a few times by people saying hello to either of you two before kirishima’s hand left your back and he walked ahead of you to the table.

  “eiji-kun!” a girl with pink hair and pink skin called out excitedly.

  the rest of the group turned to see the redhead with wide smiles, welcoming him with a hug and multiple questions of “how are you? how have you been?!”

  you stood awkwardly to the side until the pink-haired girl noticed you with wide, black and gold eyes. “eiji-kun, is this your girlfriend?!”

  your eyes widened, “huh?! n-no! we’re not—”

  “sorry, guys, i’m still single as ever! this is my partner at the agency i was transferred to, (name), also known as—”

  “(hero name),” the black-haired boy muttered in awe. “i’ve seen your work! it’s so nice to meet you! this is like, a dream come true!”

  a blush blossomed across your cheeks, “o-oh, thank you!”

  “i’m ashido!” the pink-haired girl grinned, “this is sero,” she motioned to the black-haired one, “and kaminari!” the boy with the lightning bolt stripe in his bangs smirked.

  “have you seen bakugou yet? i want to introduce him to (name),” kirishima asked.

  “bakugou’s coming?!” kaminari asked incredulously.

  “that’s what he told me,” the redhead replied with a shrug. “though, he probably found a way to get out of it.” his lips pulled into a frown, “damn, i was really looking forward to seeing him again.”

  ashido gave kirishima a small smile, “he might turn up sooner or later! but, now that you’re here, we should all go dancing!”

  kaminari’s eyes lit up, “that sounds like a great idea, you coming, (hero name)?”

  “me? oh, uh, i don’t know—“

  “come on, it’ll be fun, i promise!” kirishima pulled you with him to the dance floor, the rest of the bakusquad following suit. there was some shitty, bass-heavy club music booming from the speakers, and you could barely hear yourself think as kirishima took your hands and started to dance with you.

  your cheeks blossomed with a bright red, and you hesitantly started to dance with him, trying to find an equal rhythm with your partner. 

  it wasn’t long until you found a groove, and you started swinging your hips to the beat, the dress allowing for a little more movement than you would have expected from the tightly-fitting attire. ashido started to grind on you, and you gasped, not expecting that from the practical-stranger who you’d met not even five minutes ago, but you went along with it.

  you let your eyes wander off the dance floor as you looked around, and you notice a pair of crimson eyes trained on you from the upstairs balcony of tables, his arms resting on the rail as he was slouched over the edge. you quickly looked away, refusing to believe that the blond had been staring at you.

  a few songs later, you lot had decided to walk back to the table, sweaty and slightly out of breath. 

  “so, kirishima, what’s (name) like? big change from bakugou?” sero asked, taking a swig of whiskey from his glass. you were off getting a round of waters for the table at the bar, not a big fan of drinking yourself.

  the redhead shrugged, “somewhat. they’re both pretty wild on the battlefield, but she’s definitely nicer and a lot more levelheaded. just as observant, too, nothing gets passed her. though, she doesn’t call me shitty hair all the time.”

  “and here i thought you liked the nickname,” a voice grumbled from behind him.

  the group whipped their heads around to see bakugou dressed in a nice suit with his hero mask, mouths gaping in surprise with their eyes wide.

  “bakugou!” ashido exclaimed, giving the irritated blond a hug.

  “you actually came!” kirishima was more excited than a puppy going for a walk, wide grin plastered across his face.

  tch. “i’ve been here for a while, saw you guys looking like idiots out there,” he replied. “oi, pinky, let go of me already.”

  ashido let go of him with a sheepish blush, “sorry, it’s been so long, baku-kun! we all missed you so much!”

  “yeah, yeah,” he grumbled. “so, where’s that girl you were dancing with? she my replacement?”

  speak of the devil; you waltzed over to the table with cups stacked on top of each other in one hand, a pitcher of ice cold water in the other. “hey! sorry it took so long, this one guy would not stop talking to me,” you complained as you set the stuff down on the table, failing to notice the blond gaping at you.

  kirishima dismissed the apology with a wave of his hand, “it’s fine!”

  “yeah, you did look pretty hot out there!” kaminari wiggled his eyebrows suggestively.

  you blushed, “k-kaminari–”

  “where the fuck are your manners, pikachu?” bakugou glared.

  you jumped, finally noticing the blond who was staring at you earlier, “o-oh! you scared me.”

  he clicked his tongue, not responding to you. however, his eyes still lingered for a moment before he turned back to kirishima. “you gonna stand there, or you gonna introduce us, shitty hair?”

  the redhead blushed, “oh, bakugou, this is (name), aka (hero name), (name), this is bakugou.”

  your eyes widened, “this is bakugou?!”

  the blond glared, “what?! somethin’ wrong with me?”

  “n-no!” you stammered, holding your hands up in surrender. “i-i’ve just heard so much about you! it’s nice to finally meet you.”

  he rolled his eyes, but he didn’t say anything.

  you huffed at his behavior and turned to kirishima and his conversation with kaminari, sero, and ashido, pitching in here and there.

  when you all had quenched your thirst and sero and ashido finally reached their desired level of drunken-ness, kirishima had suggested you all head back to the dance floor, bakugou immediately declining. the other four had accepted his answer, but you hung back, not used to bakugou and knowing to leave his first answer as his final answer.

  you looked over at him, “can’t dance?”

  he scowled, “i can dance, i just don’t want to.”

  “oh, well, do you want company?” you asked.

  “just go with shitty hair, i’ll be fine by myself,” he replied.

  “are you sure?”

  “if i fucking dance with you guys, will you leave me alone?” he snapped.

  your eyes widened, “i-i–”

  he grabbed your hand, the heat of his palm surprising you, and pulled you along through the throng of people. you two couldn’t exactly get to where kirishima, kaminari, ashido, and sero were, so you stuck to some random place in the crowd.

  you hesitated, not sure exactly what to do, but you gasped as he grabbed your arms to toss around his neck, and he slipped his hands around your waist.

  “this alright with you?” he asked in your ear, you barely able to hear him over the loud music.

  you nodded and slowly started to dance with the boy, still keeping a little bit of distance. after all, you two had just met.

  “come on, i know you can dance better than that,” he smirked.

  a blush rose to your cheeks, “i, uh–”

  he pulled you tighter, your body flush against him as he started to move your bodies to the beat of the song, the smirk never leaving his cocky face. “let me know if you get uncomfortable,” he said.

  you nodded, and your body started to warm up to his, hips moving a bit more freely as you started to feel more secure with your movements, getting back into the groove you had earlier. you were completely enveloped in his scent, smelling of burnt sugar with a slight hint of campfire smoke. to others, it may have smelled strange, but it smelled heavenly to you.

  “so,” you started, gaining a bit of confidence with the hotheaded stranger, “were my eyes playing tricks, or were you staring at me earlier?” a blush still played on your cheeks as you asked him, but you daringly looked the blond in the eyes, crimson and (eye color) meeting. you looked down from his intense stare, a bit embarrassed.

  “caught that, huh?” he flashed his pearly whites. “shitty hair was right, nothing gets passed you.”

  your brows furrowed in confusion, “huh?” you looked up, realizing how close the two of you really were when your noses bumped together.

  “so, tell me, if you’re as observant as shitty hair says you are, can you tell what i want to do right now?” he whispered into your ear, lips pulled upward in a cocky grin. he pulled back to see your flustered face.

  “i, uh, i’m not sure–”

  “then stop me if it gets too far.”

  without another word, his lips met yours, crashing hard with lust and his hands gripped tightly into your waist. you let out a slight moan at the contact, fingers reaching up and pulling at his hair.

  however, just before the kiss became too heated, you heard a couple of wolfwhistles. you pulled away from bakugou quickly, cheeks a bright red as you noticed kirishima, kaminari, ashido, and sero cheering the two of you on.

  bakugou scowled at them, separating from you. he looked back to you. “to be continued, perhaps? friday night at seven?”

  your eyes widened, “y-yeah, sounds good.”


it’s a bit lengthy, but first ever imagine! wooooo
trail.content:
so, my first ever boku no hero academia imagine. wish me luck!!

  gender in this imagine will be female, if you wish for me to create this with male or genderneutral pronouns please feel free to send a message my way! i would be happy to help!

warnings: none? maybe language bc baku tho

tags: (theres too many tags for this anime but yknow. this is just a thought)
summary: hey. how come bakugo can make explosions through his gloves, and mirio’s suit can travel through objects with him, but yaoyorozu...
body: hey. how come bakugo can make explosions through his gloves, and mirio’s suit can travel through objects with him, but yaoyorozu has to be half-naked in order to make things? why do their costumes let their quirks pass through them, but yaoyorozu’s doesn’t? maybe because any excuse to have girls be sexualized is taken as logic, just as any excuse to have boys be cool is taken as a necessity

reblog.comment: hey. how come bakugo can make explosions through his gloves, and mirio’s suit can travel through objects with him, but yaoyorozu has to be half-naked in order to make things? why do their costumes let their quirks pass through them, but yaoyorozu’s doesn’t? maybe because any excuse to have girls be sexualized is taken as logic, just as any excuse to have boys be cool is taken as a necessity

trail.content_raw: hey. how come bakugo can make explosions through his gloves, and mirio’s suit can travel through objects with him, but yaoyorozu has to be half-naked in order to make things? why do their costumes let their quirks pass through them, but yaoyorozu’s doesn’t? maybe because any excuse to have girls be sexualized is taken as logic, just as any excuse to have boys be cool is taken as a necessity
trail.content: hey. how come bakugo can make explosions through his gloves, and mirio’s suit can travel through objects with him, but yaoyorozu has to be half-naked in order to make things? why do their costumes let their quirks pass through them, but yaoyorozu’s doesn’t? maybe because any excuse to have girls be sexualized is taken as logic, just as any excuse to have boys be cool is taken as a necessity

blog.name: bnha-mtc

blog.description: Inbox: 18. ~Ask box temporarily closed~ Hey everyone, this is a blog for interacting with all your favorite bnha characters. Simply send in an ask (it could be a question, or just a greeting) and they’ll respond! If you have any questions, feel free to ask ^_^ P.S. call me Satania ♥︎

summary: Since we're talking about big boys we love, All For One seems like he would give great hugs. I'd give anything to hug that man 💕
question: Since we're talking about big boys we love, All For One seems like he would give great hugs. I'd give anything to hug that man 💕

summary: Don't feel bad for making Mirio lose. He's not that well liked in the jap fandom anyway. You might as well have just voted ten...
question: Don't feel bad for making Mirio lose. He's not that well liked in the jap fandom anyway. You might as well have just voted ten times for Chisaki, if you like a character voting multiple times is fair play to help them win. Honestly, you only voted four times for him and that's not enough XD
answer:
Ehhh?? Mirio isn’t popular?? Why though? He’s such a nice guy!

I feel like 10 times is cheating too much already 😂. I already feel bad for helping him cheat cos he’s a horrible person 😂

reblog.comment:
Ehhh?? Mirio isn’t popular?? Why though? He’s such a nice guy!

I feel like 10 times is cheating too much already 😂. I already feel bad for helping him cheat cos he’s a horrible person 😂

Ehhh?? Mirio isn’t popular?? Why though? He’s such a nice guy!

I feel like 10 times is cheating too much already 😂. I already feel bad for helping him cheat cos he’s a horrible person 😂
